basics.name: Rachel R. Langgin
basics.label: Second-year Astronomy PhD Student
basics.summary: Graduate Astronomy Student at the University of Nevada-Las Vegas, Research Assistant with the LIGO Scientific Collaboration, NV NASA Graduate Research Fellow (2024-2025)

education.thesis: Spectral Analysis of Red and Blue Quasars and their Effect on Galactic Evolution

education.institution: Las Vegas Academy of the Arts

publications.name: A Candidate Dual QSO at Cosmic Noon
publications.authors: E. Glikman, R. Langgin, M. Johnstone, I. Yoon, J. Comerford, B. Simmons, H. Stacey, M. Lacy, J. O'Meara

publications.name: The Seventeenth Data Release of the Sloan Digital Sky Surveys: Complete Release of MaNGA, MaStar, and APOGEE-2 Data
publications.publisher: The American Astronomical Society. The Astrophysical Journal Supplement Series

work.name: LIGO Scientific Collaboration
work.summary: Graduate astronomy student researcher studying compact object binaries through gravitational-wave analysis with the Laser Interferometer Gravitational-Wave Observatory (LIGO) Scientific Collaboration (LSC), advised by Dr. Carl-Johan Haster.

work.name: Glikman Lab (Remote) & Masters Galaxy Group
work.summary: Conducted my undergraduate senior thesis using a radio, infrared, and optically selected sample of blue quasars to put dust-reddened red quasars in context. We found a radio-selection dependency and the fraction of red quasars to be 32% in order to complete the UKFS and W2M surveys; advised by Dr. Eilat Glikman & Dr. Karen Masters.

work.name: Glikman Lab
work.position: Keck Northeast Astronomy Consortium Research Scholar
work.summary: Studied a candidate dual quasar system using Hubble Space Telescope data and completed a spectroscopic analysis of the closely separated sources with StisTools and found the possible QSO system links dust-reddening to galaxy and black hole mergers; advised by Dr. Eilat Glikman

work.name: Masters Galaxy Group
work.summary: Researched various intrinsic parameters of galactic bars using SDSS MaNGA data, including bar length and position angle, to complete a population comparison analysis, and participated in weekly group journal presentations; advised by Dr. Karen Masters

work.name: Masters Galaxy Group (Remote)
work.position: Marian E. Koshland Integrated Natural Science Center Summer Researcher & Fellow
work.summary: Investigated galaxy kinematics and bar formation, performed elliptical isophote analysis with Photutils on MaNGA galaxies. Participated in HI data reduction, GalaxyZoo classifications, radon transform classifications, daily team collaborations, and weekly journal clubs.

work.name: Bryn Mawr Plasma Laboratory (Remote)
work.summary: Curated interactive Jupyter notebooks to cover college-level physics concepts and lessons focused on electromagnetism; advised and funded by Dr. David Schaffner.

work.name: UNLV Astronomy Lab Instructor
work.summary: AST 105: Introductory Astronomy Laboratory, Advised by Dr. David Jeffery

work.name: UNLV Physics Lab Instructor
work.summary: PHYS 196L: Electrical Engineering Laboratory, Advised by Dr. Thomas Hurst

work.name: Haverford College Astrophysics Department
work.summary: PHYS/AST/CS 104 Intro to Coding for Physics and Astronomy, Advised by Dr. Andrea Lommen

work.name: Haverford College Physics Department
work.summary: H308 Advanced Classical Mechanics following textbook by Taylor, Advised by Dr. Ted Brzinski

work.name: Carpenter & Collier Libraries
work.summary: Advised by Laura Surtees & Joyce B. Angelucci

work.name: Dining Services
work.position: Student Supervisor in Erdman and New Dorm Dining Hall

volunteer.summary: Invited speaker for the Las Vegas Astronomical Society chapter public educational Star Parties and meeting speaker operating under the College of Southern Nevada Planetarium, Dr. Andrew Kerr, Director.
Co-organizer with colleagues at the Nevada Center for Astrophysics to share the excitement of astronomy and astrophysics with the general public and local community.
Led the adjudication of annual science fairs for middle and high school students, evaluating projects for creativity, scientific rigor, and presentation skills.
Operated 12 and 16 inch telescopes to explain astrophysical concepts to students and community members while navigating the night sky through the constellations.
Operated 8 and 11 inch telescopes to explain basic astronomical phenomena in both English and Spanish for Middlebury Language School students and community members while promoting dark skies.

awards.title: NASA Graduate Research Opportunity Fellow
awards.summary: Utilizing early-warning gravitational wave signals preceding binary neutron star mergers to refine source location and observe electromagnetic counterparts in collaboration with Dr. Brad Cenko, Principal Investigator of the Neil Gehrels Swift Observatory.

awards.title: Rebel Grad Slam (RGS) preliminary round winner
awards.summary: A competition where graduate students presented their research in a condensed 3-minute format with only one slide; marking the start of the annual event showcasing graduate research at UNLV.

awards.title: Travel Scholarship for APS Conferences for Undergraduate Women in Physics (CUWiP)
awards.summary: CUWiP, or the Conferences for Undergraduate Women and Gender Minorities in Physics, is a professional conference series that helps undergraduate women and gender minorities in physics. Hosted by Princeton University and the Princeton Plasma Physics Laboratory

awards.awarder: Nominated by Dr. Karen Masters at Haverford College
awards.title: FUTURE of Physics, Women in Physics Workshop
awards.summary: Caltech's Division of Physics, Mathematics and Astronomy, in partnership with the Heising-Simons Foundation, launched FUTURE of Physics in 2018 with the goal of increasing the number of women choosing to continue to a STEM (Physics) PhD program or careers.

awards.awarder: Selected by Dr. Eilat Glikman at Middlebury College
awards.title: Keck Northeast Astronomy Consortium (KNAC) Research Scholarship
awards.summary: The Keck Northeast Astronomy Consortium (KNAC) supports undergraduate astronomy research and collaboration through a summer exchange program and annual research symposium.

awards.awarder: Selected by Dr. Karen Masters at Haverford College
awards.title: Marian E. Koshland Integrated Natural Science Center Summer Research and Valley Fellow
awards.summary: The KINSC Summer Scholars and Velay Fellowship programs provide financial support for students who are able to secure unpaid laboratory research positions or public policy internships that have a significant natural science component either on-campus or off-campus during the summer of 2021.

certificates.name: Machine Learning and AI in Time-Domain Astronomy
